newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen ends steady on Fed's inactivity.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen ends steady on Fed's inactivity.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Eurodollars futures were trapped in narrow range trade on Wednesday following an uninspiring Federal Reserve's decision overnight to leave rates steady, dealers said.
"There was no fresh news to trade on. The Fed's decision to leave rates unchanged was widely expected and factored in by the market," a dealer with a European institution said.

The Fed's decision to leave rates unchanged Tuesday left the short-end of the Japanese yield curve unscathed, dealers said. They added it reinforced expectations that the Bank of Japan would not be compelled to hike rates in the near-term.
After trading in a four-tick band, December Euroyen ended at 99.14 against its CME close at 99.15. Volume was extremely light, at 6,555 contracts.
Dealers said the market now looked towards August 28 Tankan for a reflection of Japan's economic health. Most dealers were expecting the Tankan to show a gradual improvement in the economy.
After briefly breaking its resistance at 121.00, September Japanese government bond (JGB) futures ended at 120.93, up 13 ticks from its previous close. Turnover was at 252 lots.
Dealers said positive results from Japan's 10-year bond auction fuelled JGBs to its intraday high and short-covering provided a good support.
They added BOJ's operations reaffirmed its steady rate policy.
Eurodollar futures ended a day of lacklustre trade little changed from their IMM close.
December Eurodollars closed unchanged at 94.21 against their IMM settlement. March was at 94.10 against 94.11.
